definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: The Research Team of Campsite Guidance, Haizhu District, Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 广州市海珠区营地辅导研究课题组。

sentences.english: Voluntary workers built a road to the boy's camp.
sentences.chinese: 自愿的工人建了一条路，通到男孩子们的营地。

sentences.english: These camp robbers hae become habituated to campers as a food source.
sentences.chinese: 这些营地掠夺者已经惯于将野营者作为一种食物来源。

sentences.english: I showed up at the campsite one morning to find them loading their carts.
sentences.chinese: 一天早晨，我在营地发现他们正往大篷车里搬家什。

sentences.english: It's going to rain; We'd better get back to camp soon.
sentences.chinese: 要下雨了，我们最好快回到营地去。

sentences.english: At 4000m camp, we had the first learning session.
sentences.chinese: 在4000米营地，我们上了第一堂讨论课。

sentences.english: There is a camp ground near the run ways.
sentences.chinese: 在机场跑道附近有一个野营地。

sentences.english: Many are believed to have been trained in overseas terrorist camps.
sentences.chinese: 许多人被人曾在海外的恐怖分子营地接受过训练。

sentences.english: Isn't that fun? I enjoy lying on the field at night and looking up at the starry sky.
sentences.chinese: 马可大哥喜欢夜晚时分躺在营地上，看著满天星斗。

sentences.english: Three sub- cantonments shall be placed in the periphery of each of these main cantonments.
sentences.chinese: 三个次要营地应分布在每一个主要营地的周围。

sentences.english: Three sub- cantonments shall be placed in the periphery of each of these main cantonments.
sentences.chinese: 三个次要营地应分布在每一个主要营地的周围。

sentences.english: It took China Yida one year to construct this park, which is in the middle of rugged mountains.
sentences.chinese: 就一年时间亿达公司就在巍巍的群山中建成这个营地。

sentences.english: The opinion does not survive experience of a popular Continental camping place.
sentences.chinese: 但这种说法在受人欢迎的欧洲露营地是站不住脚的。

sentences.english: Check out the planned Annapurna North Face route and camp locations marked with an arrow.
sentences.chinese: 计划攀登安纳布尔纳的北壁路线，箭头处为营地。

sentences.english: Four people need to cross a rickety rope bridgeto get back to their camp at night.
sentences.chinese: 4个人晚上要穿过一座索桥回到他们的营地。

sentences.english: On their way to the campground, they enjoyed looking at the beautiful mountains and lakes.
sentences.chinese: 往露营地的一路上，他们饱览了秀丽的湖光山色。

definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
